snippet: Those detained were part of the group Women of the Wall, which has gathered each month for the past 24 years to protest the rule that only men may pray at the wall wearing traditional garb.
abstract: Ten Women of the Wall members are detained by Israeli police for praying at Western Wall wearing prayer shawls that are traditionally used by men, in latest escalation of conflict over one of Judaism's holiest sites.
lead_paragraph: Those detained were part of the group Women of the Wall, which has gathered each month for the past 24 years to protest the rule that only men may pray at the wall wearing traditional garb.

headline.seo: Arrests of 10 Women Praying at Western Wall Add to Tensions Over a Holy Site
headline.main: Arrests of 10 Women Praying at Western Wall Add to Tensions Over a Holy Site
headline.print_headline: Arrests of 10 Women Praying at Western Wall Add to Tensions Over a Holy Site
